channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Learning In-Distribution Representations for Anomaly Detection
item.description: We show that FIRM surpasses other contrastive methods in standard benchmarks, significantly enhancing anomaly detection compared to both traditional and supervised contrastive learning objectives.

item.title: Comparison Study: Glacier Calving Front Delineation in Synthetic Aperture Radar Images With Deep Learning
item.description: Calving front position variation of marine-terminating glaciers is an indicator of ice mass loss and a crucial parameter in numerical glacier models.

item.title: Compression with Global Guidance: Towards Training-free High-Resolution MLLMs Acceleration
item.description: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) have attracted considerable attention due to their exceptional performance in visual content understanding and reasoning.

item.title: Search-o1: Agentic Search-Enhanced Large Reasoning Models
item.description: To address this limitation, we introduce \textbf{Search-o1}, a framework that enhances LRMs with an agentic retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) mechanism and a Reason-in-Documents module for refining retrieved documents.

item.title: $DPF^*$: improved Depth Potential Function for scale-invariant sulcal depth estimation
item.description: The shape of human brain is complex and highly variable, with interactions between brain size, cortical folding, and age well-documented in the literature.

item.title: The GAN is dead; long live the GAN! A Modern GAN Baseline
item.description: There is a widely-spread claim that GANs are difficult to train, and GAN architectures in the literature are littered with empirical tricks.

item.title: SWE-Fixer: Training Open-Source LLMs for Effective and Efficient GitHub Issue Resolution
item.description: The retrieval module employs BM25 along with a lightweight LLM model to achieve coarse-to-fine file retrieval.

item.title: Online Continual Learning: A Systematic Literature Review of Approaches, Challenges, and Benchmarks
item.description: Online Continual Learning (OCL) is a critical area in machine learning, focusing on enabling models to adapt to evolving data streams in real-time while addressing challenges such as catastrophic forgetting and the stability-plasticity trade-off.

item.title: Hierarchical Decomposed Dual-domain Deep Learning for Sparse-View CT Reconstruction
item.description: Recently, deep learning strategies employing image-domain networks have demonstrated remarkable performance in eliminating the streaking artifact caused by analytic reconstruction methods with sparse projection views.

item.title: Step-by-Step Mastery: Enhancing Soft Constraint Following Ability of Large Language Models
item.description: It is crucial for large language models (LLMs) to follow instructions that involve multiple constraints.

item.title: V2C-CBM: Building Concept Bottlenecks with Vision-to-Concept Tokenizer
item.description: Concept Bottleneck Models (CBMs) offer inherent interpretability by initially translating images into human-comprehensible concepts, followed by a linear combination of these concepts for classification.

item.title: Relative Pose Estimation through Affine Corrections of Monocular Depth Priors
item.description: In this paper, we develop three solvers for relative pose estimation that explicitly account for independent affine (scale and shift) ambiguities, covering both calibrated and uncalibrated conditions.

item.title: Load Forecasting for Households and Energy Communities: Are Deep Learning Models Worth the Effort?
item.description: Key findings of this research include: (1) Simple persistence benchmarks outperform deep learning models for short-term load forecasting when the available training data is limited to six months or less; (2) Pretraining with publicly available synthetic load profiles improves the normalized Mean Absolute Error (nMAE) by an average of 1. 28%pt during the first nine months of training data; (3) Increased aggregation significantly enhances the performance of deep learning models relative to persistence benchmarks; (4) Improved load forecasting, with an nMAE reduction of 1. 1%pt, translates to an economic benefit of approximately 600EUR per year in an energy community comprising 50 households.

item.title: On Measuring Unnoticeability of Graph Adversarial Attacks: Observations, New Measure, and Applications
item.description: First, to mitigate the bypass problem, HideNSeek learns to distinguish the original and (potential) attack edges using a learnable edge scorer (LEO), which scores each edge on its likelihood of being an attack.

item.title: Stream Aligner: Efficient Sentence-Level Alignment via Distribution Induction
item.description: The rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs) has led to significant improvements in their capabilities, but also to increased concerns about their alignment with human values and intentions.

item.title: A Portable Solution for Simultaneous Human Movement and Mobile EEG Acquisition: Readiness Potentials for Basketball Free-throw Shooting
item.description: Second, we investigated whether the RP differs between successful and unsuccessful free-throw attempts.

item.title: Supervised Learning with Evolving Tasks and Performance Guarantees
item.description: Existing techniques for learning tasks that are in a sequence are tailored to specific scenarios, lacking adaptability to others.

item.title: Uncertainty-aware Knowledge Tracing
item.description: Previous research commonly adopts deterministic representation to capture students' knowledge states, which neglects the uncertainty during student interactions and thus fails to model the true knowledge state in learning process.

item.title: From Mesh Completion to AI Designed Crown
item.description: The set of feature vectors is then fed into a transformer to predict a new set of feature vectors for the missing region (crown).

item.title: Finding Needles in Emb(a)dding Haystacks: Legal Document Retrieval via Bagging and SVR Ensembles
item.description: We introduce a retrieval approach leveraging Support Vector Regression (SVR) ensembles, bootstrap aggregation (bagging), and embedding spaces on the German Dataset for Legal Information Retrieval (GerDaLIR).

item.title: IPDN: Image-enhanced Prompt Decoding Network for 3D Referring Expression Segmentation
item.description: To tackle intent ambiguity, we designed a Prompt-Aware Decoder (PAD) that guides the decoding process by deriving task-driven signals from the interaction between the expression and visual features.

item.title: Solving the Catastrophic Forgetting Problem in Generalized Category Discovery
item.description: The LER optimizes the distribution of potential known class samples in unlabeled data, thus ensuring the preservation of knowledge related to known categories while learning novel classes.

item.title: A Flexible and Scalable Framework for Video Moment Search
item.description: Retrieved segments are then merged into coarse-grained moment proposals.

item.title: AD-L-JEPA: Self-Supervised Spatial World Models with Joint Embedding Predictive Architecture for Autonomous Driving with LiDAR Data
item.description: In this paper, we present AD-L-JEPA (aka Autonomous Driving with LiDAR data via a Joint Embedding Predictive Architecture), a novel self-supervised pre-training framework for autonomous driving with LiDAR data that, as opposed to existing methods, is neither generative nor contrastive.

item.title: Enhancing Plagiarism Detection in Marathi with a Weighted Ensemble of TF-IDF and BERT Embeddings for Low-Resource Language Processing
item.description: Plagiarism involves using another person's work or concepts without proper attribution, presenting them as original creations.

item.title: CellViT++: Energy-Efficient and Adaptive Cell Segmentation and Classification Using Foundation Models
item.description: Digital Pathology is a cornerstone in the diagnosis and treatment of diseases.

item.title: JAQ: Joint Efficient Architecture Design and Low-Bit Quantization with Hardware-Software Co-Exploration
item.description: The co-design of neural network architectures, quantization precisions, and hardware accelerators offers a promising approach to achieving an optimal balance between performance and efficiency, particularly for model deployment on resource-constrained edge devices.

item.title: D3RM: A Discrete Denoising Diffusion Refinement Model for Piano Transcription
item.description: In this paper, we focus on discrete diffusion model's refinement capabilities and present a novel architecture for piano transcription.

item.title: SpecTf: Transformers Enable Data-Driven Imaging Spectroscopy Cloud Detection
item.description: The Spectroscopic Transformer (SpecTf) addresses these challenges with a spectroscopy-specific deep learning architecture that performs cloud detection using only spectral information (no spatial or temporal data are required).

item.title: Improving Skeleton-based Action Recognition with Interactive Object Information
item.description: We propose a new action recognition framework introducing object nodes to supplement absent interactive object information.

item.title: A New Perspective on Privacy Protection in Federated Learning with Granular-Ball Computing
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) facilitates collaborative model training while prioritizing privacy by avoiding direct data sharing.

item.title: FairCode: Evaluating Social Bias of LLMs in Code Generation
item.description: In this study, we introduce FairCode, a novel benchmark for evaluating bias in code generation.

item.title: SensorQA: A Question Answering Benchmark for Daily-Life Monitoring
item.description: To address this gap, we introduce \Dataset, the first human-created question-answering (QA) dataset for long-term time-series sensor data for daily life monitoring.

item.title: Addressing Domain Shift via Imbalance-Aware Domain Adaptation in Embryo Development Assessment
item.description: Deep learning models in medical imaging face dual challenges: domain shift, where models perform poorly when deployed in settings different from their training environment, and class imbalance, where certain disease conditions are naturally underrepresented.

item.title: Battling the Non-stationarity in Time Series Forecasting via Test-time Adaptation
item.description: Deep Neural Networks have spearheaded remarkable advancements in time series forecasting (TSF), one of the major tasks in time series modeling.

item.title: Self-Adaptive Ising Machines for Constrained Optimization
item.description: Using a probabilistic-bit (p-bit) IM emulated in software, we benchmark our algorithm with multidimensional knapsack problems (MKP) and quadratic knapsack problems (QKP), the latter being an Ising problem with linear constraints.

item.title: LLM4SR: A Survey on Large Language Models for Scientific Research
item.description: In recent years, the rapid advancement of Large Language Models (LLMs) has transformed the landscape of scientific research, offering unprecedented support across various stages of the research cycle.

item.title: Combining YOLO and Visual Rhythm for Vehicle Counting
item.description: Video-based vehicle detection and counting play a critical role in managing transport infrastructure.

item.title: A Plug-and-Play Bregman ADMM Module for Inferring Event Branches in Temporal Point Processes
item.description: Specifically, we formulate the inference of event branches as an optimization problem for the event transition matrix under sparse and low-rank constraints, which is embedded in existing TPP models or their learning paradigms.

item.title: Comprehensive Examination of Unrolled Networks for Linear Inverse Problems
item.description: Unrolled networks have become prevalent in various computer vision and imaging tasks.

item.title: Enhancing Low-Cost Video Editing with Lightweight Adaptors and Temporal-Aware Inversion
item.description: Recent advancements in text-to-image (T2I) generation using diffusion models have enabled cost-effective video-editing applications by leveraging pre-trained models, eliminating the need for resource-intensive training.

item.title: A Closer Look on Gender Stereotypes in Movie Recommender Systems and Their Implications with Privacy
item.description: In the second phase, four inference algorithms were applied to detect gender stereotypes by combining the findings from the first phase with users' feedback data.

item.title: DCIts -- Deep Convolutional Interpreter for time series
item.description: We introduce an interpretable deep learning model for multivariate time series forecasting that prioritizes both predictive performance and interpretability - key requirements for understanding complex physical phenomena.

item.title: Evolution of Spots and Stripes in Cellular Automata
item.description: Instead of engineering cellular automata, we propose evolving cellular automata.

item.title: AutoDFL: A Scalable and Automated Reputation-Aware Decentralized Federated Learning
item.description: Reputation-aware BFL poses even more challenges, as blockchain validators are tasked with processing federated learning transactions along with the transactions that evaluate FL tasks and aggregate reputations.

item.title: On weight and variance uncertainty in neural networks for regression tasks
item.description: Variance uncertainty enhances the generalization of the model {by} considering the posterior distribution over the variance parameter.

item.title: InfiGUIAgent: A Multimodal Generalist GUI Agent with Native Reasoning and Reflection
item.description: Graphical User Interface (GUI) Agents, powered by multimodal large language models (MLLMs), have shown great potential for task automation on computing devices such as computers and mobile phones.

item.title: Enhancing Listened Speech Decoding from EEG via Parallel Phoneme Sequence Prediction
item.description: Our proposed approach allows users to obtain decoded listened speech from EEG signals in both modalities (speech waveforms and textual phoneme sequences) simultaneously, eliminating the need for a concatenated sequential pipeline for each modality.

item.title: IOLBENCH: Benchmarking LLMs on Linguistic Reasoning
item.description: Despite the remarkable advancements and widespread applications of deep neural networks, their ability to perform reasoning tasks remains limited, particularly in domains requiring structured, abstract thought.

item.title: Medical artificial intelligence toolbox (MAIT): an explainable machine learning framework for binary classification, survival modelling, and regression analyses
item.description: While machine learning offers diverse techniques suitable for exploring various medical research questions, a cohesive synergistic framework can facilitate the integration and understanding of new approaches within unified model development and interpretation.
